meanings.sent1: I will summon my friend to come over for a playdate.
meanings.sent2: The teacher will summon the students to the front of the class.
meanings.sent3: Mom will summon Dad to help with the heavy lifting.
meanings.sent4: The whistle's sound seemed to summon the birds from the trees.
meanings.sent5: The magical flute could summon creatures from the enchanted forest.

meanings.definition: Authoritatively or urgently call on (someone) to be present or to do something.
meanings.sent1: The king will summon his knights to protect the kingdom.
meanings.sent2: The boss will summon the employees for an important meeting.
meanings.sent3: The coach will summon the players to give their best performance.
meanings.sent4: The emergency alarm's blare seemed to summon everyone to action.
meanings.sent5: The ancient scroll could summon the powers of the elements.

meanings.sent1: The smell of fresh cookies can summon memories of grandma's kitchen.
meanings.sent2: The old song can summon feelings of nostalgia.
meanings.sent3: The sight of the ocean always summons thoughts of relaxation.
meanings.sent4: The painting's colors seem to summon emotions from deep within.
meanings.sent5: The familiar tune can summon images of happy times.
